sense.name: an informal photograph taken with a camera
sense.examples: Here is a snapshot of Mary and John taken on their honeymoon. We sorted through boxes of old snapshots of family vacations.

sense.name: a brief summary or depiction of something
sense.commentary: SNAPSHOT[+entity][+abstract][+information][+summary][+brief] Note: can refer to a spoken, written or visual summation or depiction.
sense.examples: The collection of stories provided snapshot of life in rural China. His lecture could only give a snapshot of such a complex industry.

sense.name: a dated fixed state repository of computer data
sense.examples: This automatic backup program will create a daily snapshot of your hard disk drive. John was able to fix the bug by rolling back to an earlier snapshot of the application software.
